title._content: [General William Crozier house, 1735 Massachusetts Ave., NW, Washington, D.C. (LOC)

description._content: Johnston, Frances Benjamin,, 1864-1952,, photographer. [General William Crozier house, 1735 Massachusetts Ave., NW, Washington, D.C. Hyacinth border and lawn] [1915?] 1 photograph : glass lantern slide, hand-colored ; 3.25 x 4 in. Notes: Site History. Associated Name: Mary Williams (Mrs. William) Crozier. Other: The house in the background was completed in 1909 at 1746 Massachusetts Avenue and is now an embassy. On slide: Blue star sticker On slide (printed): Red outline flower design, "Set no.," "Slide No.," and "Title" (all blank). For corresponding negative, see LC-J717-X107-54. Slide for lecturing on city and suburban gardens. Title, date, and subject information provided by Sam Watters, 2011. Similar to b&w photo in LOT 11727. Forms part of: Garden and historic house lecture series in the Frances Benjamin Johnston Collection (Library of Congress). Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.16681 Call Number: LC-J717-X107- 37
